senses.de: To show something that is usually hidden
senses.ex: He exposed his inner thoughts and feelings in his diary.

Tips.title: Hidden Revealed
Tips.description: Use 'expose' when something concealed is made visible, either literally or figuratively.
Tips.example: The wind exposed the hidden tattoo on his arm.

Tips.title: Metaphorical Use
Tips.description: 'Expose' can describe revealing emotions or thoughts, not just physical objects.
Tips.example: Her speech exposed deep empathy for the victims.

senses.de: To put someone in a dangerous situation
senses.ex: They were exposed to many risks during their journey.

Tips.title: Implies Negativity
Tips.description: This use of 'expose' often suggests vulnerability or placing someone in an unfavorable situation.
Tips.example: Leaving the database unprotected exposed the company to hackers.

Tips.title: Non-Physical Danger
Tips.description: Exposure can be to non-tangible threats like diseases or financial loss.
Tips.example: He exposed himself to criticism by making bold claims.

senses.de: To allow light to reach a photographic film to create a picture
senses.ex: You need to expose the film correctly to avoid overexposed or underexposed photos.

Tips.title: Photography Jargon
Tips.description: In photography, 'expose' is a technical term related to the amount of light on film or sensor.
Tips.example: If you expose a photo longer, you'll capture more details in low light.

Tips.title: Creative Effect
Tips.description: 'Expose' can be used creatively in photography to produce various artistic effects.
Tips.example: She deliberately overexposed the shot to create a dreamy atmosphere.

senses.de: To make known, especially something bad or illegal
senses.ex: The journalist exposed the corruption of the government.

Tips.title: Exposing Wrongdoings
Tips.description: Use 'expose' to talk about revealing unethical, illegal, or corrupt behaviors.
Tips.example: The audit exposed the company’s financial manipulations.

Tips.title: Journalistic Term
Tips.description: 'Expose' is commonly used in journalism for reporting that uncovers hidden facts.
Tips.example: The investigative report exposed the politician's lies.

Demonstrate.wordDefinition:
Demonstrate means to show or prove something through evidence or practical means.

In simpler terms, demonstrate is used to show something in a positive light while expose is used to reveal something negative or hidden.

Disclose.wordDefinition:
Disclose usually means to reveal information that was previously kept secret or private. For example, you might disclose your salary to a friend or disclose the details of a private conversation.

So in short, you would use disclose to share information that was previously kept private, and expose when you're revealing something that was hidden or concealed.

Display.wordDefinition:
Display means to show something publicly, often for others to admire or learn from.

It is usually used in a positive or neutral context, such as displaying artwork in a gallery or displaying products in a store.

To summarize, display is used to showcase something in a positive or neutral way, while expose is used to uncover something negative or critical.

Divulge.wordDefinition:
Divulge means to reveal or make known information that was previously kept secret or confidential, usually by choice.

It is often used when talking about personal or sensitive information. For example, a person might divulge their deepest fears to a close friend.

It can be used in a wider range of situations than divulge. For example, a journalist might expose corruption in a company or government.

Divulge is used when talking about voluntarily sharing something personal or confidential, while expose is used when talking about revealing something that was hidden or covered up, whether intentionally or not.

Manifest.wordDefinition:
Manifest means to display, to demonstrate or to show something in a clear way. It is applicable in situations where someone wants to make something evident or clear, or to bring something into existence.

Expose means to reveal something that was hidden, while manifest means to display something in a clear way.

Reveal.wordDefinition:
Revealing means to make known or disclose information that was previously unknown or kept hidden.

It can have both negative and positive connotations and is often used in a more general sense, such as revealing a surprise or revealing the truth.

Reveal is more commonly used when talking about disclosing something that was kept a secret, like revealing the identity of a surprise party or revealing the results of a scientific experiment.

Show.wordDefinition:
Expose means to reveal something that was previously hidden or unknown while show means to display or present something that is already known.

For example, if you reveal someone's secret, you expose it. If you display a painting in an art gallery, you show it.

Exposure is often used in situations where something was intentionally kept secret, while showing is about presenting information.

In conclusion, expose is used when revealing something hidden, while show is used when displaying or presenting something.

Uncover.wordDefinition:
Uncover means to reveal something that was previously covered or hidden, often in a more accidental or incidental way, such as uncovering an artifact while digging in the ground or uncovering a secret while investigating a crime.

Expose is used when someone intentionally reveals information or brings something to light, while uncover is used when something is accidentally discovered or revealed through investigation or physical removal of a cover or obstacle.

quotes.Text: If you think about it, you can have the best CGI, but you can always tell that it is CGI. Your brain can spot that is not real even though you think it looks cool. Your brain knows the truth, so you don't jump and you don't scream. It was very important for me to expose the audience to real elements.
quotes.Title: Uruguayan Director
quotes.Name: Fede Alvarez

quotes.Text: I wouldn't know what to say about something that worked in a perfect way, so I guess, in everything, I try to find what doesn't work and expose it and then see how it relates to people and their stories and their character.
quotes.Title: Greek Director
quotes.Name: Yorgos Lanthimos

quotes.Text: I went to college because I didn't have anywhere else to go and it was a fabulous hang. And while I was there I was exposed to this world that I didn't know was possible.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Tom Hanks

quotes.Text: Nine times out of ten, in the arts as in life, there is actually no truth to be discovered; there is only error to be exposed.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: H. L. Mencken

quotes.Text: My mother grew up around horses and exposed my sister and I to riding early on. It was very important to her.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Georgina Bloomberg

quotes.Text: What we observe is not nature itself, but nature exposed to our method of questioning.
quotes.Title: German Physicist
quotes.Name: Werner Heisenberg

quotes.Text: I think it's extremely important that children are exposed to reading.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Diana Gabaldon

quotes.Text: Both Mihir and I don't want to expose our life on a public platform.
quotes.Title: Indian Actress
quotes.Name: Manini Mishra

quotes.Text: I miss being exposed to the leading thinkers of the world.
quotes.Title: Canadian Author
quotes.Name: Margaret Trudeau

quotes.Text: Losing exposes character, and winning breeds it.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Stephon Marbury
